page.title: 01Dinnington and Seaton Burn
page.content: Most of the land in the block is used for agriculture but there is one colliery,an Opencast Coal Site and two villages,{DINNINGTON}and{SEATON BURN. { {DINNINGTON}is situated 7 miles N.W. of Newcastle upon Tyne on the N.E. edge of Newcastle Airport.There is evidence of Roman occupation,the present church dedicated to St.Matthew was completed in 1886 replacing a building of 1835. Several buildings including the Old School date from the 19th Century. { {SEATON BURN}is 6 miles north of NEWCASTLE and was a resting place for coach travellers between London and Edinburgh on the original 'Great North Road. A dual carriageway to Newcastle now bypasses the village heavy traffic is diverted towards the Tyne Tunnel by a roundabout north of the village.
